{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3596148,"name":"diego","username":"diego_momo4999","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/diego_momo4999/{size}/259058_2.png","created_at":"2025-04-19T06:56:05.296Z","cooked":"

Hi all!

Our team has been considering building another robot next year (Well… More like a kitbot, still counts though.) Do any teams have experience with doing this/opinions and such? It won’t be a 1:1 platform but more so for programming autos & doing drive practice.

Thanks!

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":4,"updated_at":"2025-04-19T06:56:05.296Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":13,"reads":276,"readers_count":275,"score":135.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":499725,"topic_slug":"opinions-on-building-a-dev-comp-bot","display_username":"diego","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":68349,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Locknuts are yummy."},"post_url":"/t/opinions-on-building-a-dev-comp-bot/499725/1","custom_user_title":"Locknuts are yummy.","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3596151,"name":"s-neff","username":"s-neff","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/s-neff/{size}/9062_2.png","created_at":"2025-04-19T07:14:23.689Z","cooked":"

Makes sense.

If you want to get better at robots, you should build more robots.

I’d say it’s worth it. We used last year’s chassis to test drivetrain and vision code for the first few weeks of this year and it was super helpful, and if we had more swerve modules it would’ve let us practice autos while the competition robot was being iterated. I’d recommend trying to get the same frame perimeter and drivetrain types if possible as it makes it quicker and easier to swap code between testing and competition robots.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":4,"updated_at":"2025-04-19T10:49:19.153Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":209,"readers_count":208,"score":71.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":499725,"topic_slug":"opinions-on-building-a-dev-comp-bot","display_username":"Micah","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":59402,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"1710 Alum"},"post_url":"/t/opinions-on-building-a-dev-comp-bot/499725/3","custom_user_title":"1710 Alum","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3596181,"name":"","username":"Jon1369","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jon1369/{size}/214624_2.png","created_at":"2025-04-19T11:20:49.726Z","cooked":"

Building a full on dev robot is difficult for many teams time and resource wise, but it is useful to have a driving chassis with bumpers to use for prototyping. We accidentally forgot to opt out of the kit bot this season, so we used it to help train freshman on FRC basics and let them build, wire, and program it themselves. Definitely going to try to avoid the kit bot mistake in the future, but it is nice at the start of build season to have that driving chassis even if its not the same drivetrain you use for competition just for prototyping.
